If this is possible it wasn't clear how (and I'd like to know).  If not, please add this as an enhancement.

fields.description:
The Repositories drop down does not show any recent repositories, and the admin tab of all repositories does not show the menu and all features. A few other javascript features seem to be missing as well, when run on Chrome 22, the latest from Dev Channel.

These features work correctly on the latest Safari.

The following Javascript errors are visible on the console:

Uncaught TypeError: Object function (z,L){var C;z||(z={});if(C=this.defaults){if(d.isFunction(C))C=C.call(this);z=d.extend({},C,z)}this.attributes=\\
{};this._escapedAttributes={};this.cid=d.uniqueId("c");this.set(z,{silent:true});this._changed=false;this._previousAttributes=d.clone(this.attributes);if(L&&L.collection)this.collection=L.collection;this.initialize(z,L)} has no method '_bindRoutes' bundle.js:249\\
Uncaught TypeError: Object [object Object] has no method 'autocomplete' global.js:454\\
Uncaught TypeError: Object [object Object] has no method 'dialog'
fields.summary: Unable to see recent repositories, access admin panel of repositories with Chrome 22 [dev channel] (BB-4821)

Hi,

Is it possible to get a component and a milestone field when creating tickets in our repos? Ideally we would have repo specific components and milestones that we would like to create as well.

cheers\\
Sri

Single view of ALL tickets

fields.description:
Hello, currently, when a user on my account responds to an open issue, I get no notification that they have responded, so often (unless I check every single bug, every day) I have no way of knowing the status of a bug.  With lots of issues open, it becomes very tedious, very quickly to know when someone has responded.

Would it be possible to get a simple notification email (like when bugs are opened) just saying "hey, someone responded to this issue ... link..."?

I am by no means complaining, you guys offer a great service for free, and it's appreciated, this would just make have an issue tracker so much more useful.  Thanks!
fields.summary: Need to know when someone responds to an issue

fields.description:
It would be very awesome, if there would be an option to link to a custom(meaning intern hosted) issue-tracker or information system instead of the default bitbucket issue tracker.

Now:\\
'#'2 links to\\
https://bitbucket.org/{:username}/NETAssetManagerCLI/issue/:issueID/:issueName

I propose to add a option to define a custom target for issue-marks('#') in commit-messages

After change:

default:

'#'2 links to\\
https://bitbucket.org/:username/:repoName/issue/:issueID/:issueName

But changeable to something like this:

https://company-site.bla/issues/:repoName/:issueID

Having the following placeholders available:

* :repoName
* :userName(User/Team owning the repo)
* :issueID (Number after the hash)
* :changeset (Changeset the link comes from)
fields.summary: Create issue links to custom bug tracker

fields.description:
When view binary data with REST API, the "Server Internal Error" was returned.

There is no problem with the raw api.

GitHub use the Base64 to encode binary data files and also attach a "encoding" field along with the "data" field.

Bitbucket api can do the same: base64 encode binary data with "encoding" info.
fields.summary: 'src' REST api has problem with binary data (BB-4885)

fields.description:

If a file is marked executable, we cannot find out. A "mode" field should be attached to the returned data.

fields.description:
I use aragost/projrc as a subrepo. I have no changes to be pushed in this subrepo (and I have no permission to push to that subrepo). When I try to push the master repo, projrc requests authorization. We have several other subrepos from bitbucket (for example, onsub), where this is not the case.

To reproduce the problem, just clone aragost/projrc, don't change anything and try to push:

{{{\\
D:\Users\schueler\tmp\projrc>hg push\\
pushing to https://bitbucket.org/aragost/projrc\\
searching for changes\\
no changes found\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: lantiq\\
password:\\
}}}

As far as I understand it, you should be able to push when there are no changes, because the discovery phase of push does only require read permission (which I obviously have, because I can clone the repo). See, for example, this discussion: http://mercurial.808500.n3.nabble.com/Read-Only-Subrepos-td1035083.html. I'm especially referring to this paragraph:

{{{\\
An empty push to a pullable repo should always work, regardless of\\
whether you have permission to push or not. The first part of the push,\\
discovery, is allowed for both push and pull, and the second part\\
(actually sending a bundle) is skipped if there's nothing to send.

So unmodified subrepos shouldn't be causing a problem.\\
}}}

I'm using the current Mercurial, version 2.2.3.
fields.summary: Repo "aragost/projrc" requires authorization although there are no changes to push (BB-4794)

fields.description: When changing the plan for a team -- the graphics show the incorrect amount for unlimited users. It currently says 'FREE' while it should be '$200'
fields.summary: Incorrect price for Team Plans & Pricing (Unlimited user is free) (BB-4801)

fields.description:
Hi. I'm Paul. Was cleaning up our repo on Bitbucket from old files and .dlls.

I've done 'hg convert' and reduced size of our repository from 45 MB to 1.5 MB and pushed new repo to Bitbucket, updating existing one (hg push --force). After that, I went to 'Admin' - 'Strip changesets', and deleted old repository completely.

Now, if I close our updated repo, I will really download only those 1.5 MB from Bitbucket - no joke. But on the repo overview page there is still that old huge number, even bigger - 47.5 MB.

I think it will scare people wrongfully O_0

Go to our repo (https://bitbucket.org/alex_razv/selfrenderedcontrol) to reproduce the issue.

Also, I attached a couple of screenshots: size of repo in Bitbucket UI and actual size of downloaded '.hg' folder.
fields.summary: Wrong repository size on overview page after using 'hg convert' (BB-4797)

fields.description:

Just thought it would be really cool, and not too difficult for Atlassian to add...

fields.description:
Hello,

Currently, if a developer forks a repository which is owned by our team account, and checks the "Inherit repository user/group permissions" box, the repository will be created with the tam account assigned as user with Admin permissions, and:

* Group permissions assigned to the team account repository, _excluding_ those groups which the developer is not assigned to.

We would like this to changed to:

* Group permissions assigned to the team account repository, _including_ those groups which the developer is not assigned to.

The reason being that we have two groups setup:

* Developers, with read-only access to mainline team repositories, who create forks under their own account and perform work here
* Lead Developers, handling writes to mainline team repositories e.g. pull requests from developers

And with the current functionality, this requires all memebers of the Lead Developers group to be assigned to the Developers group also, otherwise they cannot perform pull requests as they will not have read access to the source (developers) repository.

Regards,

Ryan Djurovich

Evolution 7
fields.summary: Forking team-owned repository and permissions inheritance for non-member groups (BB-4783)

fields.description:

fields.description:
Hello,

Just a small issue I noticed. When trying to rename a repo from "Myrepo" to "myrepo" i got a warning message saying a repo with that name already existed. The workaround was trivial: renaming to something different, then renaming to my desired lowercase version.
fields.summary: Renaming repo with lowercase version of original name

fields.description:
Deployment keys are a great feature, but there ought to be a way to set a deployment key as an account-wide default, particularly for team accounts, rather than only being able to set them one repository at a time.

As it is now - having to add the key to every repository - they aren't a great substitute to using a read-only deployment user. Using deployment keys necessitates entering them in for each repo, one at a time, and then remembering to do it again when new repos are created.

The fact that you can set up a read-only deployment user makes this issue less than critical, but it would be nice to not eat up that user slot.
fields.summary: Set deployment key as account-wide default (BBCDEV-3005)

fields.description:
We are a HipChat custom and a BitBucket customer and we'd like to be able to have issue tracker notifications be sent to HipChat chat rooms.  Unfortunately BitBucket will only send emails issue tracker notifications and HipChat does not support post to chat room from email.

We could build it ourselves but we don't really have the time or funds to budget for this kind of infrastructure development at the moment. And since both services are now offered by Atlasssian it seem like it's not much to ask for them to be integrated?
fields.summary: Send Issue Tracker Notifications to HipChat (BB-4774)

fields.description:
The README.md rendered on the following site uses footnotes which are not displayed correctly: https://bitbucket.org/mmottl/aifad

Search for "^lexical" to find an example.  According to the documentation of Python Markdown, footnotes should be supported since release 1.7, which was published a few years ago.  Maybe the extension has not been enabled.  If so, could you please change this?  Thanks!
fields.summary: Footnotes not working in Markdown (BB-4605)

fields.description:
There is a bug on the following overview site: https://bitbucket.org/mmottl/aifad

The README.md file that is rendered on the above page contains code blocks.  Some (but not all) of them are missing their first line.  E.g. find the text "your specification".  The immediately following code block starts with "rhs", but it should start with "type-definition".

It's not clear whether the markdown should behave like that.  The first lines are properly indented, and you can convince yourself easily that the original file contains the right text.  Could you please investigate?  Thanks!
fields.summary: Markdown swallows code block lines

fields.description:
Since few days ago all issues on https://bitbucket.org/kazandaemon/ncx_server/issues?status=new&status=open automatically marks as spam. This is private issue tracker, so there is no reason for spam filter on it.

When issue or a comment on it is marked as spam, no notification sent to followers or admins of issue tracker. Notification were not sent even if comment marked as "not spam".

How to disable spam filter on private issue trackers? Why did it enabled on it?
fields.summary: A lot of issues automatically marked as spam (BB-4547)

fields.description:
=== Synopsis ===

When you have an existent uploaded file which has already been downloaded at least once and you upload it again with updated content, the file itself does not get updated.

The file metadata which is included in the downloads page is updated (for example, the new file size is shown). But downloading the file results in the previous file being served from the cloudfront CDN.

=== Additional information ===

We have confirmed this behaviour on various pc's, and we have ruled out local caching by uploading and downloading the file from different computers.

We noticed you are using amazon cloudfront to host the actual files uploaded to the project. All the machines we tested on are located in Buenos Aires, Argentina, South America. I don't know if this has anything to do with cdn replication of the original file.

=== Steps to reproduce ===

h1. Create a text file containing a line "First"
h1. Upload the text file to a public repository by going to the downloads page of the repository (for example, https://bitbucket.org/braintag/carbonlibrestapis/downloads)
h1. Download the file by clicking on the file name on the page
h1. Edit the original text file and add a line "Second"
h1. Upload the text file again to the same repository
h1. Download the file by clicking on the file name on the page again. You will obtain the original file without the "Second" line.
fields.summary: Reuploading file does not update the file (BB-4773)

fields.description:
I have a personal Bitbucket account (account id: busstop), but also manages one for my employer (account id: KMS).

The two accounts have different email addresses assigned, and only my personal account is connected to an OpenID provider.

The "employer account" was only assumed to be used for administrative tasks for repos owned by my employer.

When I commit/push to those repos, I authenticate using my personal account name (busstop). Nevertheless, my commits end up attributed to "KMS".
fields.summary: Commits pushed by me attributed to other user.

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/kcomkar/dom-core is a clone of https://bitbucket.org/ms2ger/dom-core where everyone from the original project is given write access as well. Does not seem legit.
fields.summary: Abuse

fields.description:
Currently, when one deletes a repository, this is logged under "Recent activities" (and possibly elsewhere). Please make it possible to //silently// delete a repository. This would be useful if a repository accidentally ended up in the wild.

(The only workaround I found for this is deleting your account and then starting anew, recreating all your repositories save the one you want to delete.)
fields.summary: Make it possible to silently delete a repository (BB-4569)

fields.description:
If the user's bitbucket password has changed it should disable access using any stale cookies/cached credentials so that if leaked they can no longer be used.

Also, there should be a request for the current password to confirm that the cached credentials aren't be abused to easily change the password.

One way this might happen is for someone to distribute a VM with browser web history which a malicious user could then exploit to subvert an existing account. The mitigation would be that 1) that malicious user wouldn't be able to change the password without also knowing the password, and 2) once the legitimate user realizes this, she can change the password or clear out any cached authentications.

I realize this might change the session handling process, but perhaps these should be ephemeral anyway?

David
fields.summary: Cache'd authentication credentials

fields.description:
When visualizing commits, the tree relating branches interactions shows each one with a different color: It is OK.

It would be desirable if the branch name (displayed between commit description and its date) could be colored as its related branch was (in the tree displayed at left). So the user could easily see the commit flux in full branch perspective.
fields.summary: Repository graph tree and branches names with same color (BB-4572)

fields.description:
=== Steps to reproduce ===

h1. Open forks/queues list, for example, https://bitbucket.org/jespern/django-piston/descendants
h1. Observe avatars.
=== Actual result ===\\
A lot of avatars are blurry (see screenshot).

=== Expected result ===\\
Avatars should be crisp like in followers list.

==== Configuration ====\\
Mac OS X 10.7.4, Google Chrome 19.0.1084.56.
fields.summary: Blurry avatars in forks/queues list (BB-4570)

fields.description:
I would love to be able to set the current milestone for a project. The main reason, is so that I can set up a search query with "milestone is //current milestone//". It could also be used as a default.

Perhaps it would be appropriate to also mark milestones as completed, thus making it unselectable for new issues.
fields.summary: Add a "current milestone" attribute for a project (BB-4568)

fields.description:
When a new repository is created, all registered (inside a team account) groups have write privileges automatically granted (and, consequently, all users already contained on it).

I think the "right" behavior should be:

When a new repository is created, only Admins group and Creator have write privileges automatically granted. Other groups not even will be noticed about its creation, if they are not currently assigned to it.
fields.summary: New repository with write privileges automatically granted to all registered groups

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

h1. Create a wiki page with more than (roughly) 25 links to issues.
** e.g., https://bitbucket.org/reidpr/aurora-website-bugs/wiki/Home

Actual behavior:

* Only the first 25 issues are hyperlinked in the HTML.

Expected behavior:

* All issues are hyperlinked.

Thanks for your hard work on BitBucket!
fields.summary: Links to issues don't work beyond the first ~25 (BB-4567)

fields.description:
Hi,

I've downloaded sources from https://bitbucket.org/CarlosRuiz_globalqss/adempiere361 (zip format).

It appears that some classes were not in their last version (eg. client\src\org\compiere\acct\AcctViewerData) (2012-04-18 instead of 2012-04-19).

Regards,

Nicolas Micoud
fields.summary: Download sources / not last version

fields.description: When tried to browse a new revision it is showing - "OOPS an error occurred. We have been notified and we'll look in to the problem".
fields.summary: Someone kicked over the bucket, sadface

fields.description:
The wiki pages on bitbucket have a lot of clutter (all the repo tabs, pull links and so on) whereas I would strongly prefer to keep documentation simple-looking with much less links and clutter.

It would be nice to be able to define a skin for the wiki pages.
fields.summary: Screen clutter on wiki pages on bitbucket

fields.description:
To my understanding private repository is only completely secured from accidental public fork creation by checking the 'no public fork' option within the admin area.

For that purpose, can bitbucket make the 'no public fork' checked as default or perhaps the ability to mass-assign it, because private repositories can contains some sensitive codes and its quite a hassle to check whether the option was already checked one-by-one.
fields.summary: Make 'no public fork' checked as default for private repository (BB-4571)
BitbucketPatch object not available when loading changeset page through iframe (BB-4566)

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Issue+Comments

Since issue's statuses are modified via comments, it would be nice to be able to get these status updates via API. Maybe something like\\
{{{\\
"status_change": {\\
"old": "new",\\
"new": "resolved"\\
}\\
}}}\\
And maybe that same idea could be applied to other properties (type, priority, component) as well?
fields.summary: Add status changes to issue comments' metadata (BB-4565)

fields.description: Need better formatting in a bug content. For instance allow line breaks.
fields.summary: Formatting

fields.description:
With a new issue you can select component and milestone.

Would be great if you parse the milestones and components from:

* "Persistence\DB"
* "Persistence\File"

to a indented select

{{{\\
<select>

<option>Persistence</option>
<option>  DB</option>
<option>  File</option>
</select>
}}}
fields.summary: Enhance select of milestones or components (BB-4564)

fields.description:
Please give a link underneath a new issue that allows to add a issue that needs the current one to be resolved.

E.g. : You created issue "#1 persistence" and with that you can do other things or want to extend that in "#2 sql" or "#3 cache". So in that case a link underneath the issue (among "Actions") would be great to have (like: "Create accessory issue").

The new one could be automatically a one step lower priority for the same component, milestone and version. This will keep it intuitive and simple for end-users.

In addition a text could be added that just says "blocked by #..." or even is the beginning of an easy way to having issues blocking each other and keeping it simple and stupid.

Some very late extension could be to give a generated tree view of the issues.
fields.summary: Give a link to make "child" issues (BB-4563)

fields.description:
Hi,

Please add Gitorious.org to repository(remote source) page.\\
Thanks.
fields.summary: Adding Gitorious.org (BB-4562)
Annoying git push message (BB-4561)

fields.description:
The Changesets api (/repositories/USERNAME/REPO_SLUG/changesets) is returning *"revision": null* for queries against Git repos. Hg repos work fine, returning an integer.

As a result, only the last 50 (max) commits to a Git repo are available via the API.
fields.summary: Changesets REST API returns nulls for "revision:" vs Git repos

fields.description:
Hello,

I have some team members that complain to receive emails each time I perform some tests with groups and permissions. Could you add a checkbox or something to disable notifications from the team administration?
fields.summary: Does not send notifications for team permission updates (BB-4557)

fields.description: When you grant someone access rights via mail by accident, you will loose control over that authorization until the invitee accepts it. The problem is you cannot know the point of time so an unwelcome guest has time to take advantage of the situation.
fields.summary: Withdraw invitations (BB-670)

fields.description:
I just tried to push a new changeset, and got:

{{{\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/ged/ruby-mongrel2\\
searching for changes\\
abort: outgoing.aaaaa_servelog hook is invalid (import of "mercurialserver.servelog" failed)\\
remote: ** unknown exception encountered, please report by visiting\\
remote: ** http://mercurial.selenic.com/wiki/BugTracker\\

remote:     cmdpats, cmdoptions)\\

fields.description:
I was signing up via OpenID (via Google.com) but after authorizing the use of my OpenID for BitBucket it redirected me to what looks like the standard sign up page (but without any css styling); which to me was a bit strange.

I want to use the service but I do not want to create yet another set of credentials to do so. I thought the OpenID route would facilitate this. Please tell me if this is a bug or is it the case that I just have to go through the sign up regardless of using OpenID.
fields.summary: OpenID login via Google redirects to standard sign up page (BB-4534)
